In our series tackling some of the myths surrounding neurodiversity we focus on dyslexia myths, #dyslexia is estimated to affect around 10% of the population.

text:
@AghastFurious |Principles|
‚Ä¢Neurodiversity is an essential form of human diversity. The idea that there is one "normal" or "healthy" type of brain or one "right" style of neurocognitive functioning, is no more valid than the idea that there is one "normal" or "right" gender, race or culture.
tokenized_text: <user> | principles | ‚Ä¢ neurodiversity is an essential form of human diversity . the idea that there is one " normal " or " healthy " type of brain or one " right " style of neurocognitive functioning , is no more valid than the idea that there is one " normal " or " right " gender , race or culture .

text:
@AghastFurious The Neurodiversity Paradigm is an emergent paradigm in which neurodiversity is understood to be a form of human diversity that is subject to the same social dynamics as other forms of diversity (including dynamics of power and oppression)

text:
Neurodiversity itself first appeared in print in The Atlantic (Blume, 1998), though it is credited to Judy Singer, an autistic sociologist who used it on an autistic mailing list (Kapp, 2000, p. 2) and in her thesis (Singer, 1998). 
/2

text:
@MissAmyTobey I fell into sobs with my therapist last week. I told her that I have lived my life in fear of doing things wrong. I constantly say "sorry" for just being the way I am, endlessly apologizing for the way my brain works.

Acknowledging my neurodiversity is turning my life around.

text:
I‚Äôm starting to think about what comes next.

What‚Äôs the concept that builds on neurodiversity but is more resistant to being co-opted?

What‚Äôs the next iteration towards a more equal & equitable society for all?

That‚Äôs a lot more exciting to me than watered down neurodiversity.

text:
I think we‚Äôre at an interesting point in neurodiversity.

As a term, It‚Äôs been co-opted, watered down & used inauthentically to the point of meaningless by many which is frustrating.

But that‚Äôs also a stage in all civil rights movements‚Ä¶ It shows the power dynamic is changing!

text:
Often discussions about disability and neurodiversity can feel stagnant because we're experiencing progress in real-time.

However, progress can only be reflected retrospectively, we can only look back to see where change bursts through and how long it took to achieve.

text:
2-Screen readers will read the hashtag as one word (making no sense) as opposed to multiple ones.
It's also harder to read for people like me with dyslexia or other types of neurodiversity.
Instead of #wordwordword use #WordWordWord

What is #Neurodiversity?

Put simply, it is the differences in our brains and how they work.

text:
Go to school to learn
You've been exposed, go home.
Learn to learn at home.
It's been a week, you will come back.
Learn to learn in school (again).
(I sense a pattern)
That level of adaptability does not exist in the Average American Child.
No accounting for neurodiversity.

text:
I astound at seeing other peoples' web browsers with what looks like 100+ tabs.

My brain cannot take that kind of overload. As I connect more strongly with my own neurodiversity I see the pattern everywhere. Inbox 0, yep that too.

Just recognizing your own truth I guess.

My struggles as a neurodivergent person are not necessarily because of my neurodivergence. They are because of society *not including* my neurodivergence.

Those are two wildly different things.

#ActuallyAutistic 
#ADHD 
#Neurodiversity

text: PSA: A single person cannot be neurodiverse. Neurodiversity describes the fact that humanity's neurology as a whole is variant & expansive, the word diverse cannot be attributed to 1 person. The word you're looking for is neurodivergent/neuroatypical. Stop conflating these words.
tokenized_text: <allcaps> psa </allcaps> : a single person cannot be neurodiverse . neurodiversity describes the fact that humanity ' s neurology as a whole is variant & expansive , the word diverse cannot be attributed to <number> person . the word you are looking for is neurodivergent / neuroatypical . stop conflating these words .
